class.name: LargeInteger
class.comment: Indicates if bits lost when shifting right the two's-complement representation (affects only negative numbers).
class.javadoc:
This class represents an immutable integer number of arbitrary size.

It has the following advantages over the java.math.BigInteger class:

  • Optimized for 64 bits architectures. But still runs significantly faster on 32 bits processors.
  • Real-time compliant for improved performance and predictability (no garbage generated when executing in {@link javolution.context.StackContext StackContext}).
  • Improved algorithms (e.g. Concurrent Karabutsa multiplication in O(nLog3) instead of O(n2).

Note: This class uses {@link ConcurrentContext ConcurrentContext}to accelerate calculations on multi-cores systems.

Jean-Marie Dautelle 3.3, January 14, 2007 Wikipedia: Arbitrary-precision Arithmetic
Holds the certainty required when testing for primality (default 100, the probability for a composite to pass the primality test is less than 2-100).

Holds the format for large integers (decimal representation by default).
#parse(CharSequence,int,TextFormat.Cursor)
#format(LargeInteger,int,Appendable)
Holds factory for LargeInteger with variable size arrays.
Holds the factory for LargeInteger with no intrinsic array (wrapper instances).
Holds the default XML representation for large integers. This representation consists of a simple value attribute holding the {@link #toText() textual} representation.
The large integer representing the additive identity.
The large integer representing the multiplicative identity.
Holds Long.MIN_VALUE
Holds five.
Holds the remainder after a {@link #divide} operation.
Indicates if this large integer is negative.
The size of this large integer in words. The most significand word different from 0 is at index: _size-1
This large integer positive words (63 bits). Least significant word first (index 0).
Default constructor (no words array).
Creates a large integer with the specified 63 bits word capacity. wordLength the internal positive long array length.
Returns the large integer of specified long value. value the long value. the corresponding large integer number.

Returns the large integer of specified two's-complement binary representation. The input array is assumed to be in big-endian byte-order: the most significant byte is at the offset position. bytes the binary representation (two's-complement). offset the offset at which to start reading the bytes. length the maximum number of bytes to read. the corresponding large integer number. IndexOutOfBoundsException if offset + length > bytes.length #toByteArray

method.name: valueOf
method.comment: Ensures result is large enough (takes into account potential extra bits during negative to positive conversion).
Converts one's-complement to two's-complement if negative.

class.javadoc: Returns the two's-complement binary representation of this large integer. The output array is in big-endian byte-order: the most significant byte is at the offset position. bytes the bytes to hold the binary representation (two's-complement) of this large integer. offset the offset at which to start writing the bytes. the number of bytes written. IndexOutOfBoundsException if bytes.length < (bitLength() >> 3) + 1 #valueOf(byte[],int,int) #bitLength

Returns the large integer for the specified character sequence using the current {@link TextFormat#getInstance(Class) format}. csq the character sequence to parse. TextFormat.getInstance(LargeInteger.class).parse(csq) NumberFormatException if error when parsing.

Returns the large integer for the specified character sequence in the specified radix. csq the character sequence to parse. radix the radix of the representation. LargeInteger.parse(csq, radix, cursor) NumberFormatException if error when parsing.
Returns the large integer corresponding to the specified java.math.BigInteger instance. bigInteger the big integer instance. the large integer having the same value.
Indicates if this large integer is greater than {@link #ZERO}({@link #ZERO}is not included). this > ZERO
Indicates if this large integer is less than {@link #ZERO}. this < ZERO
Indicates if this large integer is equal to {@link #ZERO}. this == ZERO
Indicates if this large integer is an even number. (this & 1) == ZERO
Indicates if this large integer is an odd number. (this & 1) != ZERO

Returns the minimal number of bits to represent this large integer in the minimal two's-complement (sign excluded).
the length of this integer in bits (sign excluded).

Returns the minimal number of decimal digits necessary to represent this large integer (sign excluded).
the maximum number of digits.
Indicates if this number is a power of two (equals to 2 ({@link #bitLength bitLength()} - 1)). true if this number is a power of two; false otherwise.
Returns the index of the lowest-order one bit in this large integer or -1 if this.equals(ZERO). the index of the rightmost bit set or -1

Returns the final undivided part after division that is less or of lower degree than the divisor. This value is only set by the {@link #divide} operation and is not considered as part of this large integer (ignored by all methods).
the remainder of the division for which this large integer is the quotient.
Indicates if this large integer is larger than the one specified in absolute value. that the integer to be compared with. this.abs().compareTo(that.abs()) > 0.
Returns the absolute value of this large integer. |this|.
Returns the opposite of this large integer. -this.
Returns the sum of this large integer with the specified long integer (convenience method) value the long integer being added. this + value.
Returns the sum of this large integer with the one specified. that the integer to be added. this + that.

method.name: plus
method.comment: Adds smallest in size to largest.

class.javadoc: Returns the difference between this large integer and the one specified. that the integer to be subtracted. this - that.

method.name: minus
method.comment: Always subtract the smallest to the largest.

class.javadoc: Returns the difference between this large integer and the specified value value the value to be subtracted. this - value.
Returns the product of this large integer with the one specified. that the large integer multiplier. this · that.

method.name: times
method.comment: Always multiply the smallest to the largest.
this = a + 2^(n*63) b, that = c + 2^(n*63) d
Optimization for square (a == c, b == d).
this = a + 2^(63*n) b, that = c + 2^(63*n) d
Optimization for square (a == c, b == d).
this = a + 2^n b, that = c + 2^n d

class.javadoc: Returns the product of this large integer with the specified long multiplier. multiplier the long multiplier. this · multiplier.

Returns this large integer divided by the one specified (integer division). The remainder of this division is accessible using {@link #getRemainder}. that the integer divisor. this / that and this % that ({@link #getRemainder}) ArithmeticException if that.equals(ZERO)

method.name: divide
method.comment: Calculates remainder, corrects for result +/- 1 error.

class.javadoc: Returns this large integer divided by the specified int divisor. The remainder of this division is accessible using {@link #getRemainder}. divisor the int divisor. this / divisor and this % divisor ({@link #getRemainder}) ArithmeticException if divisor == 0

Returns the remainder of the division of this large integer with the one specified (convenience method equivalent to this.divide(that).getRemainder()). that the value by which this integer is to be divided, and the remainder returned. this % that ArithmeticException if that.equals(ZERO) #divide(LargeInteger)
Returns a scaled approximation of 1 / this. precision the requested precision (reciprocal error being ± 1). 2(precision + this.bitLength()) / this ArithmeticException if this.isZero()
Returns the integer square root of this integer. k such as k^2 <= this < (k + 1)^2 ArithmeticException if this integer is negative.

Returns this large integer modulo the specified large integer.

Note: The result as the same sign as the divisor unlike the Java remainder (%) operator (which as the same sign as the dividend).

m the modulus. this mod m #getRemainder()

Returns the large integer whose value is (this-1 mod m) . m the modulus. this-1 mod m. ArithmeticException m <= 0, or this integer has no multiplicative inverse mod m (that is, this integer is not relatively prime to m).
Returns this large integer raised at the specified exponent modulo the specified modulus. exp the exponent. m the modulus. thisexp mod m ArithmeticException m <= 0 #modInverse
Returns the greatest common divisor of this large integer and the one specified. that the other number to compute the GCD with. a positive number or {@link #ZERO} if (this.isZero() && that.isZero()).

method.name: gcd
method.comment: Works with local (modifiable) copies of the inputs.
Euclidian algorithm until u, v about the same size.
From here on, u is always odd.
Now u and v are both odd, so diff(u, v) is even. Let u = min(u, v), v = diff(u, v)/2.

class.javadoc: Returns the value of this large integer after performing a binary shift to left. The shift distance, n, may be negative, in which case this method performs a right shift. n the shift distance, in bits. this << n. #shiftRight

Returns the value of this large integer after performing a binary shift to right with sign extension (-1 >> 1 == -1). The shift distance, n, may be negative, in which case this method performs a {@link #shiftLeft(int)}. n the shift distance, in bits. this >> n.

Returns the value of this large integer after multiplication by a power of two. This method is equivalent to {@link #shiftLeft(int)}for positive n; but is different from {@link #shiftRight(int)} for negative n as no sign extension is performed (-1 >>> 1 == 0). n the power of 2 exponent. this · 2n.

Returns the value of this large integer after multiplication by a power of ten. For example:[code] LargeInteger billion = LargeInteger.ONE.times10pow(9); // 1E9 LargeInteger million = billion.times10pow(-3);[/code] n the decimal exponent. this · 10n
Compares this large integer against the specified object. that the object to compare with. true if the objects are the same; false otherwise.
Compares this large integer against the specified long value. value long value to compare with. true if this large integer has the specified value; false otherwise.

Returns the hash code for this large integer number.
the hash code value.

method.name: hashCode
method.comment: 1327144033 is just an appropriately large prime; 1050537101 is 263 mod 1327144033 . The result is this.mod(1327144033) .

class.javadoc:
Returns the low order bits of this large integer as a long.

Note: This conversion can lose information about the overall magnitude of the integer value and may return a result with the opposite sign.

the numeric value represented by this integer after conversion to type long.
Returns the value of this large integer as a double. the numeric value represented by this integer after conversion to type double.

Compares two large integers numerically. that the integer to compare with. -1, 0 or 1 as this integer is numerically less than, equal to, or greater than that. ClassCastException that is not a large integer.
Compares this large integer to the specified long value. value the long value to compare with. -1, 0 or 1 as this integer is numerically less than, equal to, or greater than the specified value.
Returns the text representation of this number using the current {@link TextFormat#getInstance(Class) format}. TextFormat.getInstance(LargeInteger.class).format(this)

Returns the text representation of this number in the specified radix.
radix the radix of the representation.
the text representation of this number in the specified radix.

Parses the specified character sequence from the specified position as a large integer in the specified radix.
csq the character sequence to parse.
radix the radix to be used while parsing.
cursor the current cursor position (being maintained).
the corresponding large integer.
NumberFormatException if error when parsing.

method.name: parse
method.comment: Reads up to digitsCount at a time.

class.javadoc: Formats the specified large integer in the specified radix and into the specified Appendable argument. li the large integer to format. radix the radix. out the Appendable to append. the specified Appendable object. IllegalArgumentException if radix is not in [2 .. 36] range. IOException if an I/O exception occurs.
